articles.author: Alahna Kindred
articles.title: NASA to hurl aircraft into space to smash asteroid at 23,000km an hour and save Earth - The Mirror
articles.description: The £240m mission is expected to take place in September as new technology is being developed to hurl a half-tonne spacecraft into an asteroid called Dimorphos similar to the Netflix film Don't Look Up
articles.content:
NASA is getting ready to smash an asteroid with an aircraft at 23,000 kilometres per hour to prevent it from colliding with Earth.

articles.author: Lizzie May
articles.title: This is what a black hole sounds like: NASA releases audio recorded by its Chandra X-ray observatory - Daily Mail
articles.description: NASA has released the audio of a black hole at the centre of Perseus galaxy cluster more than 200 million lightyears away from earth, recorded by the Chandra X-ray observatory.
articles.content:
NASA scientists have released the audio of a black hole at the centre of Perseus galaxy cluster more than 200 million lightyears away from earth.
